memberdef.argsstring: (const char *restrict const path, char *restrict dirs, const size_t dirs_size)
memberdef.name: FMC_cutFilename

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *restrict const path, char *restrict filename, const size_t filename_size)
memberdef.name: FMC_extractFilename

briefdescription.para: Gets the filename from a complete path.

detaileddescription.para:
Axel PASCON
2023
Basically, this function only detects the last '/' or '\' character. For example, if the path is "C:\\Users\\someone\\Documents\\MyFile.txt", the function will return "MyFile.txt". If the path is "/home/someone/Desktop", then Desktop will be considered as the filename. This function is designed to only operate on strings, and do not check if the path is valid, is a file or a directory, etc.
path
The path to extract the filename from.
filename
The buffer where the filename will be stored.
filename_size
The size of the filename buffer.
A pointer to the filename buffer.
NULL
If the path is NULL, if the filename buffer is NULL or if an error occured. The error can be viewed by setting FMC_ENABLE_DEBUG to True .
The filename buffer must be at least as big as the path.
The maximum filename size is MAX_FNAME_SIZE . You can disable some warnings or error messages by defining FMC_ENABLE_DEBUG to False .

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *restrict const path, char *restrict ext, const size_t ext_size)
